trainings.name: Artisan
trainings.description: You can mend damaged armor without the aid of an artisan. Each square of durability takes an hour to mend.

trainings.name: Bloodthirsty
trainings.description: Whenever anything dies by your hand you regain your Luck Dice.

trainings.name: Brawler
trainings.description: You get +1 to Melee Combat when you aren't armed with weapons.

trainings.name: Chef
trainings.description: When describing an end of day meal, roll for a Cooking challenge. On a 3+, all players regain their Luck Dice.

trainings.name: Disciple
trainings.description: Whenever you heal or aid someone you regain your Luck Dice.

trainings.name: Abjurer of Evil
trainings.description: Spirits, demons, and the undead cannot attempt to harm you directly unless they are especially powerful.

trainings.name: Crusader
trainings.description: Whenever you defeat a spirit, demon, or the undead you regain your Luck Dice.

trainings.name: Healer
trainings.description: You can make a medicine roll to gather helpful herbs and heal a single character's wound over the course of an hour.

trainings.name: Lucky
trainings.description: You have two Luck Dice instead of one. When you regain a Luck Dice, you only regain one at a time.

trainings.name: Magical Musician
trainings.description: You can use Performing instead of Spellcasting when casting spells. This only works if you sing or use an instrument as part of casting the spell.

trainings.name: Mage Initiate
trainings.description: You have room for 4 spells in your spellbook.

trainings.name: Mage Adept
trainings.description: You have room for 8 spells in your spellbook.

trainings.name: Mage Ascendant
trainings.description: You have room for any number of spells in your spellbook.

trainings.name: Pack Mule
trainings.description: You can carry an additional Heavy Item.

trainings.name: Ritualist
trainings.description: If you are part of a Ritual and you aren't injured, you can use your own blood in the place of the Ritual Item. Doing so injures you.

trainings.name: Skulker Thief
trainings.description: Whenever you steal something valuable you regain your Luck Dice.

trainings.name: Tenacious
trainings.description: When you're hindered due to injury, use a d6 instead of a d4.

trainings.name: Wanderer
trainings.description: Whenever you find something lost to time or undiscovered you regain your Luck Dice.

trainings.name: Wanderer Druid
trainings.description: On gaining this training choose an animal no larger than a bear and no smaller than a mouse. You can shapeshift into that animal at will.

trainings.name: Wanderer Tamer
trainings.description: You have an animal companion who joins your adventure. The companion has its own health, personality and motives however it considers you a friend so long as you treat it well. You may also instead have a number of small animal companions like sparrows or squirrels.

trainings.name: Warrior
trainings.description: Whenever you finish combat you regain your Luck Dice.

trainings.name: Heavily Armed
trainings.description: You can wield two handed weapons without being hindered.

trainings.name: Heavily Armored
trainings.description: You can wear heavy armor without being hindered.
